result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Poupart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns.
Must obtain a valid drivers license.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J Poupart

records.addlTxt: 12:33 PM Defendant Joseph J Poupart in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Defendant Joseph J Poupart in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CM79 and 15CM197. State - here for SEHR on both cases. 15CM79 - counts 1 & 2 and 15CM197 4 & 5. Svehlek indicates no inaccuracies on revocation paperwork. State is asking for 6-9 months of jail on all counts concurrent to each other. Asks for 7 months on each count, concurrent to each other and credit on 15CM79 for 80 days. Svehlek is asking for 4 months in county jail, believes 15CM79 days credit should be more than 80 days and is asking for a time served sentence. Discussion on credit and will give credit on 15CM79 - for 80 days and 95 days credit on 15CM197. Court revokes probation and imposes 150 days in the FC jail on each count, concurrent to each other, credit for 80 days on 15CM79 and 95 days credit on 15CM197, huber and good time allowed on jail sentence. Turn any monies owed into civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 21, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations - Order sent to Judge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph J Poupart in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:54 AM. Called 15CM79 & 15CM197. Burns  -  has an agreement on both cases and has provided court with PLQ and recites agreement. 15CM197 - Defendant will be pleading to counts 1, 2, 4 & 5 as alleged, remaining counts will be DRI. Ct. 1 - 30 days jail with good time, (53 days credit as stipulated to by parties, costs only. Count 2 - 45 days jail (concurrent to count 1) with good time and credit left over from count 1. (any remaining credit will be applied to count 4, if revoked). Count 4 - with hold sentece and place on probation for 24 months with conditons of: AODA, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry int any bars or taverns, full time emp/school with verbage, must obtain a valid drivers license, costs, 19 days credit if revoked. Count 5 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 24 months concurret to count 4 with same conditions, no additional community service hours, costs. 15CM79 - defendant will be pleading NC to counts 1 & 2.  Count 1 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 12 months (concurrent to case 15CM197) with conditions of , AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, 25 hours of community service, full time employment, obtain DL license. Count 2 - with hold sentence and place on probation 12 months, (concurrent to count 1 and  15CM197) same conditions with no additional community service hours, costs only collected thru porbation.  - Count 1 - 30 days jail and court costs. (53 days credit) Count 2 - 45 days jail concurrent to count 1 applying 34 days credit. Leaving 23 days of credit remaining, if revoked. Poupart agrees. Court DRI counts 3, 6 & 7. 15CM79 - Counts 1, 2, 4 &  5 defendant enters NC plea. 15CM197 - counts 1 & 2 - defendant pleads NC. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea and right to trial. Court finds factual basis & adjudges guilty of counts 1, 2, 4, & 5 on 15CM197 and counts 1&2 on 15CM79. Court DRI counts 3, 6 & 7 on 15CM197. State makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation and asks for early release from probation if conditions are met. Poupart with holds statement. Court will proceed to sentencing:

15CM79 - Count 1 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 12 months, costs on each count, AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, 25 hours of community service, full time employment, obtain DL license. 4 days jail credit if revoked. Count 2 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 12 months, concurret to count 1 and case 15CM197, same condions, no additional community service hours.

15CM197 - Count 1 - Count 1 - 30 days FC jail, good time with credit of 53 days (jail credit will be applied), costs. 19 days jail credit remain - if revoked, Count 2 - 45 days jail, concurrent to count 1, costs. Counts 4 & 5 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, with conditions of: AODA with follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, full time employment, must obtain valid DL, 125 hours community service. DNA with expungement rights, appeal rights.

Defendant Joseph J Poupart in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Joseph J Poupart in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:31 PM. Also called 15CM197. State - here for a return on a warrant on 15CM79 and INIT on 15CM197. Burns just received complaint on 15CM197 and has not gone over it with the defendant. Poupart does not have complaint in 15CM197. Court reads charges and penalties in 15CM197. Burns and Poupart understand charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts on all cases. Court accepts plea, sets both matters for FPT. Burns - bond - asks for signature bond on both cases or reduced cash bond. State - bond - wants clarification as to why the defendant failed to appear for court on 9/23/15. Poupart responds, no good excuse. State - bond - asks for at least $500.00 cash bond remain in effect on 15CM79 and asks for $1000.00 signature bond on 15CM197. Court - bond - 15CM197 - modifies bond to $1000.00 signature bond with same conditions. Burns - on 15CM79 - not resolved for stated reasons. Court - 15CM79 - sets for FPT on same date and time - $500 cash with same conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
